title: 9 Easy Steps to Partition a Hard Drive with the Fdisk+Format Tools

steps.title: Insert your boot diskette and turn on your pc.
steps.content: Insert your boot diskette and turn on your pc.

steps.title: At the a:
steps.content: At the a: prompt type fdisk then hit enter.

steps.title: Click yes you want to use large disk support.
steps.content: Click yes you want to use large disk support.

steps.title: To Delete the existing partition, Type 3 and press Enter.
steps.content: To Delete the existing partition, Type 3 and press Enter. Select your partition type you want to delete (Primary/Extended/Logical/Non-Dos) Select shown partition by typing the displayed number of partition and press Enter for confirmation for deleting partition.

steps.title: To re-create a new partition, Type 1 and press Enter.
steps.content: To re-create a new partition, Type 1 and press Enter. Select what type of partition you want to create and type related value and press Enter for creating new partition.

steps.title: At the a:
steps.content: At the a: prompt type fdisk/mbr ( that fdisk your master boot record.

steps.title: At the a:
steps.content: At the a: prompt type format c:/s/u and yes you want to erase all data so type "y" when prompted...
